    Dr. Vivin Vinod begins his first postdoctoral assignment at the University of Wuppertal

    less than 1 minute read

    Published: June 01, 2025

    Dr. Vivin Vinod will continue his research at the University of Wuppertal under the aegis of the Zaspel group. He will continue his work on multifidelity method development for quantum chemical applications. Read more

    Access Publication | Download Bibtex

    QeMFi: A Multifidelity Dataset of Quantum Chemical Properties of Diverse Molecules

    Published in Zenodo, 2024

    We provide the Quantum chemistry MultiFidelity (QeMFi) dataset consisting of five fidelities calculated with the TD-DFT formalism. The fidelities differ in their basis set choice: STO-3G, 3-21G, 6-31G, def2-SVP, and def2-TZVP. QeMFi offers to the community a variety of QC properties such as vertical excitation properties and molecular dipole moments. Further QeMFi offers QC computation times allowing for a time benefit benchmark of multifidelity models for ML-QC. Read more

    Recommended citation: Vinod, V., & Zaspel, P. (2024). QeMFi: A Multifidelity Dataset of Quantum Chemical Properties of Diverse Molecules (1.1.0) [Data set]. Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.13925688
    Access Publication | Download Bibtex

    Assessing non-nested configurations of multifidelity machine learning for quantum-chemical properties

    Published in Machine Learning: Science and Technology, 2024

    How does the heterogeneity of training data structure affect multifidelity methods? Read to find out. Read more

    Recommended citation: Vivin Vinod and Peter Zaspel 2024 Mach. Learn.: Sci. Technol. 5 045005
    Access Publication | Download Bibtex

    Predicting Molecular Energies of Small Organic Molecules With Multi-Fidelity Methods

    Access Publication | Download Bibtex

    Investigating Data Hierarchies in Multifidelity Machine Learning for Excitation Energies

    Published in Journal of Chemical Theory and Computation, 2025

    Develops the novel Gamma-curve approach and assesses different data scaling hierarchies in multifidelity schemes. Read more

    Access Publication | Download Bibtex

    Excitation Energy Transfer between Porphyrin Dyes on a Clay Surface: A Study Employing Multifidelity Machine Learning

    Published in Advanced Theory and Simulations (Wiley), 2025

    Multiscale simulation of exciton transfer using multifidelity machine learning. Read more

    Recommended citation: D. Lyu, V. Vinod, M. Holzenkamp, et al. “ Excitation Energy Transfer between Porphyrin Dyes on a Clay Surface: A Study Employing Multifidelity Machine Learning.” Adv. Theory Simul. 8, no. 11 (2025): e00271. https://doi.org/10.1002/adts.202500271
    Access Publication | Download Bibtex

    Benchmarking data efficiency in Δ-ML and multifidelity models for quantum chemistry

    Published in The Journal of Chemical Physics, 2025

    Evaluates cost-efficiency trade-offs in multifidelity methods with applications to excitation energies and molecualr dipole moments. Read more

    Recommended citation: Vivin Vinod, Peter Zaspel; Benchmarking data efficiency in Δ-ML and multifidelity models for quantum chemistry. J. Chem. Phys. 21 July 2025; 163 (2): 024134. DOI: 10.1063/5.0272457
    Access Publication | Download Bibtex

    LoUQAL: Low-fidelity informed Uncertainty Quantification for Active Learning in the chemical configuration space

    Published in arXiv, 2025

    Proposes a novel low-fidelity guided active learning scheme that reduces the bias of the model. Read more

    Recommended citation: arXiv:2508.15577 [physics.chem-ph]
